Notes
Strength
Used for blocking, melee attacks, physical feats, athleticism.
Agility
Used for dodging, ranged attacks, actions involving coordination, skill with your hands/fingers.
Intellect
Used for healing and actions that require thinking and knowledge.
Charisma
Used for interacting with other human beings.
Perception
Ability to sense and notice things in the environment, your reflexes.
Willpower
Resist physical and mental conditions and damage.

Combat Bonuses

Block
Reduce damage of an attack by blocking with an item. Add skill amount to a strength roll. Multiply successes by item's block value.
STR +
Dodge
Avoid attacks on yourself. Add skill amount to an agility roll. Each roll success reduces an attacks success.
AGI +
Melee
Skill with melee weapon attacks. Adds skill amount to a strength roll. Multiply successes by an melee weapon's attack value.
STR +
Ranged
Skill with ranged weapon attacks. Adds skill amount to a strength roll. Multiply successes by an ranged weapon's attack value.
AGI +
Running
Determines how fast you run and if you trip while running.
AGI +
Throwing
Ability to throw an object. Add skill amount to a strength roll.
STR +
Unarmed
Skills with fighting hand to hand and grappling. Add skill amount to a strength roll.
STR +

Skill Bonuses

+
+
+
+
Ability
Level
Lvl 1 -   Aimed Shot
Spend 1 action to gain 4 bonus rolls on your next ranged attack this turn.
Lvl 2 -   Enhanced Aimed Shot
Your Aimed shot now adds 6 bonus rolls. You can now accumulate 2 aimed shots in one turn to apply it to a ranged attack next turn as long as the attack is the first action you take.
Lvl 3 -   Critical Strike
Anytime you have 10 or more successes on a ranged attack, deal double damage.
Lvl 1 -   Go Team Go!
Spend 1 action to give 2 bonus rolls to adjacent/nearby allies. Increase Fatigue by 10.
Lvl 2 -   You can do it!
Target 1 ally. They gain bonus rolls equal to your Charisma instead. Increase Fatigue by 10.
Lvl 3 -   Cheering you on!
Fatigue Cost for Cheerleader actions now only increases by 5.
Lvl 1 -   Stay Behind Me
You can take damage directed at adjacent or nearby allies.
Lvl 2 -   Shield Bash
Excess block exceeding an attack can now be dealt as damage.
Lvl 3 -   Turtle Mode
At the start of your turn, you can enter defensive mode. You take half damage but deal half damage.
Lvl 1 -   Active Reload
You can now combine reloading and moving. Reloading no longer ends your attack phase (you can now attack right after reloading).
Lvl 2 -   Hit and Run
You can now combine moving and attacking as a single action with a -4 roll penalty.

Flaws

?
Bonus Rolls will always be set to -4 in low-light/dark environments.
?
Taking damage or failing an action can cause you to drop your glasses. Bonus rolls are set to -6 when your glasses are dropped.
?
You must take special medicine every day or else reduce your current health by 50%, minimum of 10. Start the game with 3 special medicine.
?
Set your Fatigue Cost to 4.
?
Bad things seem to happen around you.
?
Your character occasionally trips or knocks things over.
?

Equipment

Slots:
Item 1
Item 2
Item 3
Item 4
Item 5
Item 6
Health
Your character dies when this reaches 0. Lose 1 dice from your Body Pool per 10 health lost.
Max:
Sanity
Your character goes insane when this reaches 0. Lose 1 dice from your Mind Pool per 10 sanity lost.
Max:
Energy
This is the number of dice you roll whenever you make any action. Reduced by 1 for every 10 Fatigue.
Max:
Fatigue
Every 10 points of fatigue reduces Energy by 1. Every action will usually cause you to gain fatigue.
Ammo
Primary
Pistols, Submachine Guns, Rifles
Heavy
Snipers, Shotguns, Magnums
Special
Bows, Crossbows, Grenade Launchers
Roll Options
Roll Type
Active
Free
Bonus Rolls
Fatigue Cost
